instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, magsafe orange light
threads.message:
came in looking good, not turning on
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 12.58v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> : keep cycling between 3.4 and 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> : cycling
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> : cycling
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> : cycling below 30mv, i will treat is as 0v then
is this tps problem ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, magsafe orange light
threads.message:
Original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger?

Try SMC bypass mode first.
Check <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> area for corrosion.
Do you get steady 32KHz at pin 12?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, magsafe orange light
threads.message:
yeah magsafe 2 85w
ok i will try smc bypass : not working
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> no corrosion, magsafe unplugged, but pin 12 not steady, cycling

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, magsafe orange light
threads.message:
Cycling DC level,or 32KHz oscillation is not constant?

"magsafe unplugged"
Why???
You need to make the board works on charger first.
Let the battery unplugged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, magsafe orange light
threads.message:
sorry I mean 32 khz oscillation is not constant at pin 12 of <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
battery is unplugged

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a not turning on, magsafe orange light
threads.message:
3V42 steady at pin 13?
If yes, change <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>.
